name: Flexblocks
author: Cabezi

sections.description:
Flexblocks is the most comprehensive flexbox solution for the Gutenberg Block Editor. Flexblocks was designed to work best with Cabezi Headless Hosting, but should work great with any block theme. Some features like Cabezi Products will only work with Cabezi Headless Hosting.

Tired of installing bloated block libraries to implement some ultra-specific layout? Flexblocks fixes that, since we enable nearly any layout possible with flexbox.

Flexblocks is built for pro web developers and power users who are familiar with designing layouts with flexbox.

Flexblocks is ultra lightweight, allowing for perfect lighthouse scores.

Flexblocks includes the following blocks:
* Flexblocks Container
* Flexblocks Item
* Button (more configurable that the core/button block)
* Span (used to create semantically correct buttons)
* Divider (an improved divider that works in Flexblocks containers)
* Embed Block
* Social Sharing Block
* Accordion Block

Flexblocks also supports background blur, eager loading images, conditional rendering, and much more.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/flexblocks directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
sections.faq:
Will Flexblocks work with my theme?

Flexblocks was designed to be theme independent, but may not work with all themes.

Is Flexblocks compatible with other block libraries?

Flexblocks was designed to be a standalone page builder, it may or may not work with other block libraries.

1.2

Release Date 4th April 2023

  • Support for background images and gradients in Flexblock Container and Flexblock Item

1.1.1

Release Date 28th February 2023

  • Remove banners

1.1.0

Release Date 28th February 2023

  • Add field for page background color
  • Add support for VH and VW units in Flexitem and Flextainer
  • Add option for background blur in Flexitem and Flextainer

1.0.0

  • Initial Release

short_description: Unleash the power of Flexbox from the Block Editor.  Flexbox is the easiest way to implement custom advanced layouts in WordPress.
description:
Flexblocks is the most comprehensive flexbox solution for the Gutenberg Block Editor. Flexblocks was designed to work best with Cabezi Headless Hosting, but should work great with any block theme. Some features like Cabezi Products will only work with Cabezi Headless Hosting.

Tired of installing bloated block libraries to implement some ultra-specific layout? Flexblocks fixes that, since we enable nearly any layout possible with flexbox.

Flexblocks is built for pro web developers and power users who are familiar with designing layouts with flexbox.

Flexblocks is ultra lightweight, allowing for perfect lighthouse scores.

Flexblocks includes the following blocks:
* Flexblocks Container
* Flexblocks Item
* Button (more configurable that the core/button block)

cabezi/button.name: cabezi/button
cabezi/button.title: Flexblocks Button
cabezi/button.description: A simple and highly configurable Button Block

cabezi/flexitem.name: cabezi/flexitem
cabezi/flexitem.title: Flexblocks Item
cabezi/flexitem.description: A simple and highly configurable Flexbox Item Block suitable for use inside the Flexbox Container Block

cabezi/accordion.name: cabezi/accordion
cabezi/accordion.title: Those Dang Accordions
cabezi/accordion.description: A simple and highly configurable accordion block suitable for use inside the Flexbox Container

cabezi/flextainer.name: cabezi/flextainer
cabezi/flextainer.title: Flexblocks Container
cabezi/flextainer.description: A simple and highly configurable flexbox container block

cabezi/divider.name: cabezi/divider
cabezi/divider.title: Flexblocks Divider
cabezi/divider.description: A simple and highly configurable divider block that renders an <hr> element

cabezi/embed.name: cabezi/embed
cabezi/embed.title: Embeddable Arrangements
cabezi/embed.description: A simple and highly configurable embed block.

cabezi/span.name: cabezi/span
cabezi/span.title: Just a Span
cabezi/span.description: A simple and highly configurable span block that renders a <span> element.  Mainly for use inside the Flexblock Button Block.
